body: Good, assuming the test passes and no other `core.netigso` tests are failing... Let's integrate.
This PR looks strange - it looks as if this PR is not based on the master branch.

@matthiasblaesing Maybe, tarbear123 used this PR for not a PR but an issue report. So, we should close this PR. Actually, the notice2019 branch is in apache/incubator-netbeans repo.

@tarbear123 If you have some requests, please report them to the [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/NETBEANS/issues) . If you have questions, please join the [mailing lists](https://netbeans.apache.org/community/mailing-lists.html).
Great, makes sense.
I had to read the code multiple times, to see the logic, but I agree the change looks sane. Merging.
The change looks good. You might want to "fix" the entry for `CONFIG` for consistency (see the leading space).
Great!

Hi @jlahoda . Request you to merge  [PR-21](https://github.com/jlahoda/incubator-netbeans/pull/21)
In the pull request I had incorporated your patch for nb-javac for removing support of old javadoc APIs[]

@junichi11 @matthiasblaesing , I try to do a PR via web github for only chaning a 8 to a 9 :p using a name linke notice219. I should have used a more complicated name. tarbear123 is not having a fork of this repo.
Shall this one be part of NetBeans 11.0?

The patch seems to be fair, I'd like to include it into NB 11.0, though, it would be good to have a corresponding JIRA issue on it, and actually what this patch does. I'm guessing this would be required to have the mixed compilation of some languages (like Groovy) work.
I think this makes sense and is needed when dev versions of Subversion are used.
Awesome, need this for sure, merging.
This issue has been around since NetBeans 8.2, so I wouldn't say that it is necessary for this to be a part of NetBeans 11.0.
Let's have it on the master then...

@lkishalmi, thanks for the comment. This is (only) for Java, in case the classfiles for the dependencies are missing in the caches (for whatever reason, but more typically due to a bug somewhere), the Java parser will use the source files to create the model. But it currently processes the dependencies too deep, it should be enough to simply "enter" them (which finds which classes and methods are in the source files), not "attribute" them (which also analyses the method bodies and is much slower). Not sure how important is to backport this, I'd be fine with not backporting this and letting it settle in master for some time.

Installer build job for Linux and Windows installers:
https://builds.apache.org/job/netbeans-installer-test/

No option to select Mac host for building Mac OSX installer from Jenkins job. Same script can be used to build Mac installer on local Mac.

Windows installer exe and Mac installer need to be signed.  Awaiting Code Signing service account for signing exe. Mac installer signing under testing. Ref bug INFRA-17946.
Wow, this is awesome.
Harmless trivial NPE check. Merging...
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-2223
Just added WIP label until the requested changes arrive.

I think the approach seems good to me. Travis does not seem to like the patch, though:
```
 [nbmerge] Failed to build target: all-updatecenters

BUILD FAILED
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:514: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:509: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:556: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nb/updatecenters/build.xml:51: exec returned: 1
```

Moreover, would it be possible to generate the keystore into the build directory (or into the cluster directly), so that the checkout is not polluted with additional files (even if they are .gitignored?).
The temporary keystore with the signing certificate is now generated into `build/ide.ks` and included at proper location via `release.*` property in the `nbproject/project.properties` file.
Yeah, the user experience is certainly better than it was before. I agree with the fix.
Also should this change affect master as well or just specific to the release branch?

Steps to build installers are here:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Installer+Build+Steps

As of now I think I don't have any more pending items for this PR.
This PR has entire installers code for Donation 3 from NetBeans Hg repository. I have added support for building NetBeans installers using current artifact(binary zip). Haven't removed old code which may not be useful now. This cleanup exercise can be taken up separately in another transaction.
Excellent, many thanks. Can you estimate the percentage of the code that needs to be removed?

Some of this code I can see is historical from older installer implementations and not used in 8.2 installer as well, so that can be removed. There's also code that is for installers from cluster level binaries as in 8.2 release. If we plan to continue having one integrated release binary as since 9.0 release, this code is also not required. Then we have JDK bundles related code, with older JDKs support still present. We were also likely bundling GlassFish, Tomcat, WLS (https://github.com/rtaneja1/incubator-netbeans/tree/rtaneja-donation3-installer/nbbuild/installer/components/products). These may also be removed. So this all maybe around 35 - 40 percent of code.

Thanks @lkishalmi for the review. Rather than copying the files from a ZIP file, let's copy them from the `layer.xml`! The 03c5e39 commit contains an example how that could be done (iOS files are still in the ZIP as there is too many of them). More work will be needed on processing the template files and placing them in the right packages...

Could you please fix the commit message?
see: https://netbeans.apache.org/participate/submit-pr.html

Maybe, `*.mdd` files are not AL. see: https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/404eb9481beba31856b66b50fce440f18ae4a8a3/enterprise/j2ee.dd/licenseinfo.xml 
@matthiasblaesing Could you please take a look at this?

@junichi11 you are right, the license change is not correct and must not be committed (the files were not part of an oracle donation, but integrated from a 3rd party source).
@borisheithecker it needs to be established, that the files you want to be merged are all from a donation. Then the license change needs to be applied (again only on the donated files). This is easiest done by splitting it into two commits: commit 1) import the files commit 2) update the license headers. If you then provide some info how the contents can be compared with the donated files it would be great.

Okay, I made a mistake converting the license headers. Sorry for that. 
Maybe provide a new pull request? 
If this is to be done as @matthiasblaesing comments, the PR will have at least 2 commits. 
Also, the following changes are required: 
1. ".hgignore" in the donated zip needs to be rewritten immediately to a corresponding ".gitignore". 
2. Fix netbeans-l10n/build.xml to work with jdk8
Let it be 4 commits?

To check the integrity of the file files from this commit with the files from the donated zip file:
1. First, merge only the first commit (328b07c)
2. Go the project root, do "find netbeans-l10n/ -type f -exec md5sum {} + | sort -k 2 > md5sum.txt"
3. Unzip ApacheNetBeansDonation3.zip and subsequently netbeans-l10n.zip
4. Go to the unzipped directory ApacheNetBeansDonation3/
5. Repeat step 2.: ..... md5sum-orig.txt
6. diff -u md5sum-orig.txt path_to_incubator-netbeans/md5sum.txt. An empty result is expected.
Works for me.

This will be part of NB 11, right? It is hard to figure out, for which version it is coming. Only guessing from the merge date.

Thank you for providing an updated PR, I'll have a look at in the next few days. As a hint for the future: There is no need to create new PRs in these cases, at least github and gitlab support updating PRs in place by force-pushing to the tracked branch. Feel free to either close this PR or update this PR with your modified approach.
Looks good to me.
Awesome, merging.

Thank you - I'll only comment on the license side of the import. I want an opinion from others more knowledgeable of the l10n part of the netbeans infrastructure, if the source code location is sensible and/or if we should open a separate repository of the the l10n data.

- the procedure you described to verify, that only donated files were imported works (I had to rename my intermediate directory from the netbeans-l10n.zip, but that works ok). The first commit is ok from my POV.
- the license change (second commit) is good to be separated, as it turns out, it is not complete:
```shell
# Get the files, that were imported (first commit)
git diff --name-only c6eb7aa76370f9a059736b686ba2b1f5f622e87c..328b07c6203fa2268c49bb0bd6b7c9d51636ddc4 | sort > imported.txt
# Get the files, that had changes (this assumes, that the license header was updated) (second commit)
git diff --name-only 328b07c6203fa2268c49bb0bd6b7c9d51636ddc4..3fc7acd08836cc736d96c81fe53f3b6efaad2445 | sort > modfied.txt
# both lists should match, as it is assumed, that all files carry the Oracle/Sun CDDL/GPLv2CP header and so output should be empty
diff imported.txt modfied.txt 
```

Running the output of diff through diffstat reveals, that 6287 were not caught. My gut feeling tells me, that you missed the files, that Oracle inherited from Sun and never updated.
- the change in the ignore file looks sane
- the build change (last commit) looks ok, as we target JDK8 as minimum runtime JDK

I ran the convert tool from https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans-tools to bulk replace the license headers. A large number of files without any license header can be found in the donated zip. It seems that these are the files revealed by your script. This can be either because they can't have one (.gif files for localized image resources, .url files pointing the translated online resources), or because they're not supposed to have one like the many bundle_xx.properties files that contain translated strings for the names of modules. 
The convert tool only replaces, it doesn't insert a license if none was present. 

I suggest that a separate repository for the l10n bundles shouldn't be used. The build scripts assume that the bundles are placed in a subfolder of the root directory, and if they're pulled from a different repository, I think that make working with the source only more difficult.
cc: @masakikatakai

Indeed the files are partitially broken. Here is the list of all files, that are not updated in the second commit:

[unmodified.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/files/2993504/unmodified.txt)

One of the files (netbeans-l10n/src/zh_CN/webcommon/html-angular/html-angular/org/netbeans/modules/html/angular/Bundle_zh_CN.properties):

[Bundle_zh_CN.properties.txt](https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/files/2993510/Bundle_zh_CN.properties.txt)

Some one added property definitions above the license header. This makes it now much harder to fix the files. In all fairness - the sample is a mess:

- license in the middle of the file
- dead definitions, that are masked as comments

These files all need to be cleaned up. What IMHO could be done:

- check if the license header is mostly the same
- if so, remove it from the middle of the file
- add the ALv2 header
- repeat for variations

As said, I've used the convert tool from incubator-netbeans-tools. The sources of it show that for .properties files it expects the original license to be at the top. That could be adapted to also detect a valid but misplaced license somewhere in the middle of the file and consequently remove it and insert the new Apache license at the top of the file. 

My question is what to do with the (text) files which were donated without any license at all.

The files, that don't have a license, but could hold one (property files, java files, ...) need one added. There are options to relex that requirement if the text is used in the GUI and adding the license header would interfere with the display.
And no action is required for binary files (image resources)?

Ah sorry - good question. For the regular modules this is solved by introducing an "licenseinfo.xml". That files contains the necessary data. See here for an example:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/master/ide/image/licenseinfo.xml

This might be interesting:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Legal+FAQ
Specificly:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Legal+FAQ#LegalFAQ-licenseinfoPerfileinfo-licenseinfo.xml

I've got some work nearly ready for supporting CSS @supports rules.  Combined with this pull request, that should stop the Bootstrap CSS showing parsing errors in NB.

I'll hold off on submitting a PR until this is approved, so as not to conflict with recompiling the lexer and parser for the Antlr grammar.

I do have a question for @matthiasblaesing or anyone else knowledgeable - I notice you haven't adding any new interfaces/classes to the CSS Source Model library.  This is the bit that is taking my time / annoying me at the moment (may have to refactor my grammar rules to make it easier to build an OO model) - how essential is this, and where does it get used?

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/master/java/java.source.base/src/org/netbeans/modules/java/source/parsing/JavacParser.java

validateCompilerOptions removes any unsupported parameters.

@peedeeboy did you have a look at the changeset? If you agree, I'll merge.

For the model - sorry, I think I can't give direct advise. If you have some code, I'm willing to have a look though.

I was somehow relying on the conversion tool, but now, reviewing the converted files, I understand that it far from converts everything. It's a great number of files and fixing them all is incremental work and it's definitely going to take much more time. 
I'm making small commits to make changes trackable - for now fixing the original license headers so they can be auto converted later. 
I'm adapting the convert tool from incubator-netbeans-tools to catch more of the uncomplying licensing cases. It's on github (https://github.com/borisheithecker/incubator-netbeans-tools/tree/netbeans-l10n), my working branch is netbeans-l10n.

@peedeeboy you are right - don't apologize, I indeed missed, that the spec for variables defines where it can be used as "nearly everywhere". In contrast to the calc function, the spec is very inprecise about the usability of the var function. I'm looking into it again ...

Looks good. There's also harness/apisupport.harness/windows-launcher-src/app.exe.manifest , which should ideally be updated for consistency as well.

More generally, is there a checklist somewhere for steps that must be taken whenever a new release is to be cut out? We should include the bumping of these version constants there.

Here would be a good place:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Apache+NetBeans+Release+README

The actual list is here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-2052
This item is new on the list as this come up the first time. Or maybe as we were working with pre-built launcher artifacts at that time.
Anyhow it is there now. The next RM just need to clone the issue and will have the todo-s for the next release.

Yes, the first PR should deal only with the licenses. But this is not yet done completely.
For the next steps, we need to think about how the contribute should be used in the future. Do we want a multilingual IDE or only localisation support for platform applications?
Great! Could you update harness/apisupport.harness/windows-launcher-src/app.exe.manifest as well? Then it looks ready to merge.

Ah. Excuse me, doing 3 things at once :) 
Yes, that works.
Yes, it compiles the grammar.
Yes, it builds.
Yes, it runs.
Yes, it is correct for every test case I have in my limited repertoire of CSS, including completion of var names.
Thank you.
@svatoun Thank you for reviewing it! Yes. I also think so. `set` and `map` are as well? They are already included by default. If some users don't expect it, they can remove it easily as a workaround.

Good examples (map, set). Actually I do not remember these abbreviations got in my way, so the same is hopefully true for `main` as well. The only possble clash is on class level, but I can't think of "regular" case when main+tab is used; even the user declares `main` field, the next typed character is most likely `;` space or `=`.
Tested several examples, all work great!  Awesome stuff :)
Merging.
I had a look into the code, but it means, that the dialog for a SQL connection is still there, right? This was not removed. The dialog comes up, when you hit ctrl + space inside a SQL file.

Sorry - I missed the description in this PR. The intention of this PR is to change nothing on the user facing side. All processes in the GUI and below stay the same. The issue is: When closing an SQL editor, there is a change, that there is a deadlock. This blocks the UI indefinitely and thus you have to kill netbeans.

The root of the deadlock lies in the fact, that a UI thread and a RequestProcessor both try to access synchronized functions in SQLEditorSupport. This PR removes the synchronized primitives and 
a) either replaces them with volatile variables (the changes around dbcon and executing) or
b) introduce a more finegrained lock, that has less potential for lock conflicts (logger).

I think you are thinking about a different issue (code completion without an sql connection).
Thx, for the explanation. Now it is a bit more clear. Yes i thought it could be this issue but as i had a look into the code, i could answered it by myself.
Thank you both for checking. Will merge.
@PhilippBaumi "Pull requests" is not an issue tracker. If you have issues, please report them to the [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/NETBEANS/issues).

Please remove the whole easeldemo project and the references to it and the images:

- in the build.xml the task "zip-examples" needs to be removed
- the jar target does not need to be overriden anymore and thus can be removed to

The update looks good so far, but needs on update:
_/webcommon/web.client.samples/build.xml_: Remove lines 25-32 (that are the two targets `jar` and `zip-samples`. Both are not needed, after the removal of the Easel sample
_/webcommon/web.client.samples/license.xml_: Remove all "<file>...</file>" entries, that start with "EaselDemo". 
That should fix the build.
Sorry I thought I had done that, turns out I hadn't committed and pushed these two changed files.

The PR is failing in the ergonomic test, because the now removed zip is still referenced - in the layer the entry for "ResponsiveRabbits" needs to be removed and the corresponding entry in the bundle can be removed true.

This is the resulting diff:

```diff
diff --git a/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/layer.xml b/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/layer.xml
index 280c2c7..065d47c 100644
--- a/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/layer.xml
+++ b/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/layer.xml
@@ -27,14 +27,6 @@
                 <folder name="HTML5">
                     <attr name="SystemFileSystem.localizingBundle" stringvalue="org.netbeans.modules.web.client.samples.wizard.ui.Bundle"/>
                     <attr name="position" intvalue="210"/>
-                    <file name="ResponsiveRabbits" url="Easel.zip">
-                        <attr name="displayName" bundlevalue="org.netbeans.modules.web.client.samples.wizard.ui.Bundle#Templates/Project/Samples/HTML5/ResponsiveRabbits"/>
-                        <attr name="position" intvalue="100"/>
-                        <attr name="iconBase" stringvalue="org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/resources/HTML5_project_icon.png"/>
-                        <attr name="instantiatingIterator" newvalue="org.netbeans.modules.web.client.samples.wizard.iterator.SampleWizardIterator"/>
-                        <attr name="instantiatingWizardURL" urlvalue="nbresloc:/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/resources/ResponsiveRabbits.html"/>
-                        <attr name="template" boolvalue="true"/>
-                    </file>
                  </folder>
             </folder>
         </folder>
diff --git a/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/wizard/ui/Bundle.properties b/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/wizard/ui/Bundle.properties
index be2f343..07fdb3c 100644
--- a/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/wizard/ui/Bundle.properties
+++ b/webcommon/web.client.samples/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/client/samples/wizard/ui/Bundle.properties
@@ -15,7 +15,6 @@
 # specific language governing permissions and limitations
 # under the License.
 Templates/Project/Samples/HTML5=HTML5/JavaScript
-Templates/Project/Samples/HTML5/ResponsiveRabbits=Responsive Rabbits

```

Without this change, the PR still fails locally in the ergonomics test, with it, it runs cleanly.
No worries, will do. (Note we have 4 +1s for 11.0 and this one will be in the next release. I.e., this is not a blocker for 11.0.)

Another question: There are several files in this PR which contain licensing statements not in the file header but as a localisable string to be displayed to the user (see, for example, netbeans-l10n/src/af/other/installer/infra/build/web/js/common_strings_af.js). 
These pieces of text surely will have to be updated, too, but does is have to be done for the first PR already?
Will merge by wednesday if noone objects till then.
I think it would be good to merge this - Geertjan, others, could you please take a look? Thanks!
If this is not a blocker for 11, is the "Need cherry picking " label still needed ?
True.
But we were thinking about doing another voting candidate, i.e., vc5 , in which this one would be cherry picked, but vc5 will not be needed.

Just a note from Frankfurt before leaving Europe behind.
I think if we would have NB 11.1 in the summer, that would be branced/released from this branch, so cherry picking would be required.

There seems to be `ide/libs.jaxb` module - ideally everyone needing JAXB could depend on it.

Once the build is fixed, I'd suggest to integrate. The fact that NetBeans is going to be buildable by JDK11 is an enormous step forward and there is no need to delay its integration. My 2 K opinion.
Looks good to me. Please squash before merge though. Thank you for taking care.

@arusinha Vikas does not have committer status, so he can't merge the changeset himself. On github the status of the person requesting the merge is quickly visible in header of the PR comment. Compare yours (notice the "Member" entry) to Vikas "Contributor". In this case I'd advise to merge after you approved.

This assumes of course, that you are not waiting for a second review.
